intro: Discocapnos dregei, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are small, leathery, and often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Discocapnos dregei is adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
